subject: Pornography and Obscenity
Olympic Games
lead_paragraph: John F. Krimsky Jr., a former top fund-raiser for the United States Olympic Committee, faces child pornography charges in Connecticut. The 68-year-old Krimsky, an executive in the YankeesNets business merger that eventually led to the formation of the YES Network, pleaded not guilty in state court this week to four counts, including promoting a minor in an obscene performance, criminal attempt at possession of child pornography and third-degree possession of child pornography.Investigators seized his home computers and found 329 images that appeared to be child pornography. Some were of children who appeared to be from ages 5 to 15 posing or involved in sexual acts, according to a warrant.
